sub_title: Supply Planning Manager DECO, 3rd Parties, at AkzoNobel

profile_positions.description:
- Lead and manage the Supply Planning Team for your BU/Region to ensure the required service to the customer and the appropriate balance with costs and inventory for both finished goods and materials. 
- Be the primary interface between the Business Unit and Supply Planning in EMEA.
- Ensure the region is meeting the targets month after month in terms of OTIF (Delivery Capability), Inventory (DIO) and SLOBs (%) optimizing the impact on manufacturing, logistics and procurement costs.
- Implement and develop the needed processes and tools to perform the required planning activities.
- Develop the team and ensure their engagement.  
- Support the BU Supply Chain Manager on side projects and the deployment of the strategy and operational plans into the region.
- Ensure a good communication and integration with demand/Bus, manufacturing, procurement, logistics and finance.
profile_positions.title: Supply Planning Manager, Third Party Manufacturing

profile_positions.description:
- Represent Planning in cross functional-/hub projects, e.g. related to legal changes, production transfers, big multimarket and multisite NPIs, insourcing initiatives, tenders, value engineering initiatives, regional quality initiatives, etc. 
- Lead or support in planning related CI improvement initiatives/projects within region to improve leading metrics like OTIF and inventory/supply chain costs
- Drive capability improvements within the team and implement new concepts, tools and processes in collaboration
- Responsible for consolidated RMP forecast sharing to procurement and suppliers to secure supply of materials on mid and long term needs for selected critical materials / suppliers in close cooperation with Procurement and the Planning hubs
- Coordination of bigger cross hub material shortages for E&A AMP and NW-Europe in close cooperation with procurement
- Embedding vendor OTIF process with procurement and sites 
- Tactical and strategic support in the area of production- and material planning 
- Leads/supports region with OWC improvements and/or consolidation 
- Act as point of escalation for operational team to give technical support for SAP & other tooling
- Manage CI initiatives & projects independently within the team and other stakeholders
Proactively identify areas for improvement or concern and resolve/ address them accordingly
- Manage / Coordinate operational projects like the coordination of big multi site material shortages, transfers or insourcing initiatives / projects independently
Solve escalated operational issues and when needed further escalate to design team and / or TMS (SAP related)
